props.title: What is a For Loop?
props.prompt:
A for loop is used to repeat a block of code a specific number of times. In Java, the syntax is: for(int i = 0; i < n; i++) { ... }

The loop has three parts:
1. Initialization: int i = 0 (start value)
2. Condition: i < n (continue while true)
3. Increment: i++ (increase i by 1 each iteration)

Let's practice writing your first for loop!
